alert.note: Alert for Camas (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 04 at 4:25PM MDT until August 04 at 7:30PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boise has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Camas County in southwestern Idaho... * Until 730 PM MDT. * At 425 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter reports. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Blaine Bridge, Kelly Reservoir and Selby. At 4:23 PM MDT a trained spotter reported 2.65 inches of rainfall in an hour, and that several vehicles were trapped in flood water on Highway 20. Ponding is occurring over Highway 20 with heavy rainfall continuing. Also reported one-inch hail. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
